reviews.review_msg: Very kind lecturer. The topic wasn't one I was particularly interested in, nor would I have taken if not mandatory for business students, but her lectures were engaging and she's very passionate and knowledgeable. One complaint I have was the lack of timely feedback, but that was more to do with her TA's and she was reachable to rectify the issue.

50% of course was 2 online open book midterms
TAs marked the discussion posts harshly and inconsistently

Review of the online section of the class. Not sure how she teaches the in person section. Course is not even taught by her, it is prerecorded lectures from another prof (Joyce). Like below review stated, 50% of grade in 5 quizzes. Each quiz requires crazy memorization based on around 4-5 readings, videos, lectures. Not a GPA booster as many claim.

This class is ridiculous, more about memorization than content. 50% of your grade is MC quizzes. Professor is unfamiliar with content as it is an old class from another professor. Unresponsive to messages and does not appreciate questions. TAs were great. Has potential to be a great class with a little effort from prof. Do not recommend.

This prof appears to be nice and friendly but her course does not at all reflect that. The discussion post criteria is not clear and hard to do well on. The grading is reliant on you having revelations about boring course content. The organization and assignment instructions are overcomplicated and confusing. Not a GPA booster, hard to do well.
Sandie is great and knowledgeable and nice but her TAs are bad
